bend.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to move part of your body so that it is not straight or so that you are not upright
bend.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Bend your knees, but keep your back straight.
Emma bent over to pick up the coins.
I bent down to lift the box off the floor.
He bent towards me and whispered in my ear.
bend.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to push or press something so that it is no longer flat or straight
bend.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: You need a special tool to bend the steel.
bend.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to become curved and no longer flat or straight
bend.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Several branches started bending towards the ground.
bend.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: when a road bends, it changes direction to form a curve
bend.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The road bends sharply to the left.
bend.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a curved part of something, especially a road or river
bend.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The car came round the bend at a terrifying speed.
a sharp bend in the road
bend.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: an action in which you bend a part of your body
bend.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: We started the session with a few knee bends to warm up.
bend.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: That road sign means you are approaching a sharp bend.
The road wound up the mountain in a series of hairpin bends.
Ahead of us there was a wide bend in the river.
Never overtake another car on a blind bend.
Take the turning just after the left-hand bend in the road.
Suddenly a motorbike came around the bend at top speed.
He rounded the bend much too fast.
